sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都可表示"工资，收入"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: earnings, allowance, income, salary, wage, pay, fee
means: earnings ： 多指通过劳动或投资等手段所得到的收入。
allowance ： 指收入中的补贴部分。
income与earnings含义很相近，但前者强调总收入。
salary ： 指按年定下，按月或星期平均给予的报酬，指脑力劳动者的薪水。
wage ： 多用复数形式，指按小时、日或星期的报酬，通常指体力劳动者的工资。
pay ： 是个通用词，可取代salary与wage.
fee ： 指提供某种服务收取的固定费用。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"收入"之意。
means: revenue ： 专指国家或企业的收入，主要指国家的税收。
income ： 主要指个人收入，包括劳动所得和利润。

sentence.Network_en: Tourism is up, jobs are up, individual income is up.
sentence.Network_cn: 旅游火了，工作机会多了，个人收入涨了。

sentence.Network_en: Somalia, pop. 7.9 million, income per head about £1.60 a week.
sentence.Network_cn: 索马里，人口790万，人均收入大约每周1.60英镑。

sentence.Network_en: She suggests you first assess your income and outgoings.
sentence.Network_cn: 她建议你先估算一下自己的收入和开销。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'entrance, arrival', now only Scots): in early use from Old Norse innkoma, later from in + come. The current sense dates from the late 16th cent

entry.def: A person's or organization's income is the money that they earn or receive, as opposed to the money that they have to spend or pay out.

example.ex: Many families on low incomes will be unable to afford to buy their own home...
example.tran: 许多低收入家庭将会买不起自己的房子。

example.ex: To cover its costs, the company will need an annual income of £5 million...
example.tran: 公司年收入需要达到500万英镑才能收支平衡。

means.word_mean: 1. the financial gain (earned or unearned) accruing over a given period of time

Sentence.sentence: Rather, with incomes decreasing and insecure jobs, unhappy couples often couldn't afford to divorce.
It can develop between people with a big difference in income.
Her husband feels it's unnecessary for her to work since the family does not need the added income.
A 2012 press release from Statistics Sweden bears the title "Gender Equality in Sweden Treading(踩)Water" and notes: 1、The total income from employment for all ages is lower for women than for men
Starting in the 1980s, skill in finance grew in importance, and, as depicted in the news media and the movies, became a more appealing source of income.
It generated just 12% of the gross national income

means.word_mean: 收入, 所得, 收益

sentences.en: He deceived his friends about his income.
sentences.cn: 他在自己的收入问题上欺骗了朋友。

jushi.english: Henry's taxes averaged out to about a fourth of his income.
jushi.chinese: 亨利交付的税款平均为他收入的四分之一左右。

jushi.english: The cost of living is now so high that you need to earn a good income just to keep your head above water.
jushi.chinese: 现在生活费用太高了,你需要有相当的收入才能勉强维持生活。

jushi.english: Her income this year approximates to 5000 dollars.
